title: 'Weight lifted': Tigers top Guardians, tie for 1st
content: Detroit snapped an eight-game losing streak, beating Cleveland to move back into a tie with the Guardians atop the American League Central with three games to play.

title: Seahawks sing Darnold's praises after GW drive
content: Seahawks coach Mike Macdonald raved about Sam Darnold's poise after the quarterback led the team down the field for a game-winning field goal Thursday night against the Cardinals.

content: While LeBron James enters his eighth season with the Lakers in a contract year, coach JJ Redick's future with the team is clear after being signed to an extension.

title: Lindor makes history as Mets make playoff push
content: Francisco Lindor reached the 30-30 mark for the second time in his career when he homered as the Mets captured a big series win over the Cubs.

title: Bryson-Thomas to lead off U.S. team at Ryder Cup
content: Bryson DeChambeau and Justin Thomas will be paired in the the first match of foursomes (alternate-shot) at the Ryder Cup on Friday at Bethpage Black as captains for the respective teams unveiled their morning groups.

title: Cards' Harrison flops early, lights up 4th with TD
content: Cardinals receiver Marvin Harrison took a knee to celebrate his late touchdown catch, the highlight of an up-and-down Thursday night in which he was the target on both of Kyler Murray's interceptions.

title: L. Paul sues auction house over MJ-signed court
content: Logan Paul has filed an injunction against Heritage Auctions, saying he was not allowed to investigate the authenticity of a Michael Jordan-signed piece of United Center floor that Paul won at auction.

title: Raleigh meets fan who gave 60th HR ball to boy
content: The fan who gave a 12-year-old boy Cal Raleigh's 60th home run ball Wednesday night in Seattle returned to T-Mobile Park on Thursday and was gifted a signed Raleigh bat and two baseball -- which he gave to his kids.

content: Tanner Tessmann hasn't represented the U.S. since March, but he has been so good at Lyon in 2025-26 that Mauricio Pochettino can't keep ignoring him.

content: Twenty years after winning his first F1 championship, Fernando Alonso is still on the grid, still revered, and still hungry for another world title.

title: Raj Kundra Transferred 15 Crores To Shilpa Shetty's Firm: Police Sources
content: The Economic Offences Wing (EOW) of the Mumbai Police has made a significant revelation in the ongoing investigation into the alleged Rs 60 crore fraud involving businessman Raj Kundra and actress Shilpa Shetty.

title: What Next For Retired MiG-21 Fighter Jets? Explained In 5 Points
content: It's a bittersweet day for the Indian Air Force (IAF) as its legacy fighter jet, the MiG-21, retires. The Russian-origin fighter jet's induction in the early 1960s catapulted the IAF into the jet age. Where will the retired jets be kept? We discuss.

title: "Am I Playing Marbles Here?" Ajit Pawar Snaps At Flood-Hit Farmer's Request
content: Maharashtra Deputy Chief Minister Ajit Pawar sparked a political row on Friday after a video of him snapping at a farmer who questioned him over a loan waiver, in rain-hit Marathwada region, went viral.

title: Ranchi's Vatican City-Themed Durga Puja Pandal 'Conversion Ploy', Alleges Right Wing Group
content: A Durga Puja pandal in Ranchi, with the theme of 'Vatican City', has angered the Vishwa Hindu Parishad which alleged that it has been done to "hurt religious sentiments of Hindus" and encourage conversion

title: Asaduddin Owaisi's Sheikh Hasina Jibe At PM Over 'Infiltrators' Remark
content: Asaduddin Owaisi has assured that there are no Bangladeshis in Bihar, especially in the Seemanchal region, where his party had won big in the last polls.

title: What Delhi High Court Told Sameer Wankhede On ""Ba***ds Of Bollywood" Defamation Case
content: Sameer Wankhede filed a defamation case against actor Shah Rukh Khan's Red Chillies Entertainment and Netflix for allegedly maligning his reputation in their series 'The Ba***ds of Bollywood'.

title: How Climate Change And Warming Oceans Led To Kolkata's Historic Downpour
content: As Kolkata begins to mop up after one of its worst deluges in recent memory, scientists warn that such extreme weather events are no longer anomalies - they are becoming the new normal.

title: PM Modi Pays Tribute To Manmohan Singh On His Birth Anniversary
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi on Friday paid tribute to Former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh on his 93rd birth anniversary, recalling his contributions to the nation during his years in public life.

title: Indore Man Rams Ex-Girlfriend With Two-Wheeler After She Refuses To Reconcile
content: A young man riding a scooter deliberately rammed into his ex-girlfriend after she resisted his pressure to continue their relationship in Madhya Pradesh's Indore.

title: Why Trump's 100% Pharma Tariffs May Not Impact Indian Drugmakers Much
content: US President Donald Trump has said his administration will impose 100 per cent import tariffs on branded or patented pharmaceutical drugs from October 1, unless the pharma companies have or are building their manufacturing units in America.

title: Madras High Court Evacuated, Searches On After Bomb Threat Email
content: A bomb threat to the Madurai Bench of the Madras High Court this morning created panic, leading to the immediate evacuation of court staff and litigants.

title: Madhya Pradesh High Court Raps State Government For Shielding Minister
content: The court was hearing allegations against Govind Singh Rajput for concealing assets worth crores in his 2023 assembly election affidavit.

title: Astronauts With Diabetes May Soon Travel To Space: Study
content: Astronauts with diabetes may soon be able to undertake space missions safely, a study conducted during Shubhanshu Shukla's travel to the International Space Station has found.

title: Foxconn Workers Faced Tough Conditions During Rush To Make iPhone 17: Report
content: Chinese factory workers suffered difficult conditions while racing to get Apple Inc.'s new iPhone 17 lineup ready, according to a report from China Labor Watch.

title: Opinion: What A 'Win-Win' TikTok Deal Means To China
content: When President Donald Trump first brought up banning TikTok due to perceived national security concerns more than five years ago, the app from Beijing-based ByteDance Ltd. was the envy of the global tech industry.

title: Oracle's Larry Ellison, World's 2nd Richest Person, To Donate 95% Of His Wealth
content: Larry Ellison is currently the world's second-richest person, with a net worth estimated at $350 billion.

title: Team Trump Mulls Adding Autism Symptoms To Vaccine Injury Program
content: The Trump administration is considering ways to allow people with autism to seek compensation through a government vaccine injury program, according to an adviser, in a change likely to throw it into disarray.

title: "Delhi On Phone With Putin": NATO Chief's Big Claim Over US Tariff Impact
content: NATO Secretary-General Mark Rutte has said that US President Donald Trump's tariffs on India for purchasing Russian oil are having a "big impact" on Moscow.

title: Bengaluru Shopkeeper Hits Woman For Stealing Sarees Worth Rs 90,000
content: The Bengaluru police have arrested a shopkeeper and his assistant for assaulting a woman in the broad day light on Sunday for allegedly stealing sarees worth Rs 90,000.

title: Trump Declares 100% Tariff On Pharma Imports From October 1, India May Be Hit
content: US President Donald Trump has announced tariffs of up to 100 per cent on imports of branded and patented pharmaceutical products from October 1. India's pharmaceuticals sector, one of the most dependent domestic industries on trade with America.

title: Dentures ‚Äòyour fault‚Äô: What US authorities told 73-year old grandma when she refused ice
content: Harjit Kaur, a 73-year-old woman who lived in the US for 30 years, faced deportation after her asylum applications were denied. During her detention, she was allegedly denied proper medical care, food, and basic hygiene.

title: 'Delhi calling Moscow': Nato chief says PM Modi asked Putin about Ukraine
content: Nato chief Mark Rutte supported Donald Trump's tariffs on India, asserting they pressure Russia over the Ukraine war. Rutte highlighted Modi's concerns to Putin due to the tariffs and Trump's commitment to his policies. He noted Russia's weakened position, citing significant losses and economic strains, while emphasizing Zelensky's role in any territorial negotiations.

title: 'Make him CM': Ajit Pawar loses cool ‚Äî chides flood-hit farmer over loan waiver question
content: During a visit to Maharashtra's flood-hit Marathwada, Deputy CM Ajit Pawar faced farmers' demands for loan waivers. Pawar, visibly frustrated, responded sharply, highlighting existing welfare schemes like Ladki Bahin and electricity bill waivers.

title: 'Tests your nerves': Praggnanandhaa plays jenga with friends to unwind - watch video
content: Indian chess prodigy R Praggnanandhaa, fresh off his Sinquefield Cup performance and Tata Masters win, unwinds by playing Jenga, showcasing his ability to balance focus and relaxation. His recent achievements, including a rivalry with D. Gukesh, highlight India's growing chess prominence.

title: Microsoft ends Israel's cloud access: Exec says evidence found; Israel replies
content: Microsoft has ceased providing cloud and AI services to an Israeli military intelligence unit after an investigation revealed its use for mass surveillance of Palestinian civilians. Unit 8200 had been storing millions of intercepted phone calls on Microsoft's Azure platform. The decision follows employee pressure and a UN commission's findings, raising questions about storing sensitive military intelligence on foreign-owned platforms.

title: 'Pata chal raha hai': Pathan roasts Pak's fielding after missed run out
content: Pakistan clinched a spot in the Asia Cup 2025 final by defeating Bangladesh by 11 runs in a Super Four match, despite facing batting challenges and fielding errors. Salman Ali Agha's team will now face India in the final on September 28. Irfan Pathan criticised Pakistan's fielding mishap during the match, highlighting a missed run-out opportunity.

title: Delhi molestation: 'Godman' files anticipatory bail plea
content: The Patiala House Court has reserved its order on the anticipatory bail plea of Swami Chaitanyananda Saraswati. Delhi Police opposed the bail, stating that the accused has been on the run. He is accused of illegally withdrawing Rs 60 lakh and possessing two passports. He also faces allegations of sexual harassment and misconduct.

title: Bengaluru woman slapped, kicked, dragged on floor 'for stealing sari'
content: In Bengaluru, a textile shop owner, Umed Ram, and his employee, Mahendra Seervi, were arrested after a video surfaced showing them assaulting Hampamma, a 55-year-old woman, for allegedly stealing sarees. Ram accused Hampamma of stealing 61 sarees worth Rs 91,500. The video, recorded by onlookers, prompted police action after going viral.

title: Top H‚Äë1B employers in 2025 : Amazon, Microsoft, Meta & others - check list
content: Amazon secured the most H-1B visa approvals in the first half of 2025, followed by TCS, Microsoft, Meta, and Apple. These tech giants utilize the program to employ skilled professionals in specialized roles.

title: 'Unfortunate': Pakistan 'boycotts' World Para-Athletics in India
content: Pakistan has boycotted the World Para Athletics Championships in New Delhi, citing security concerns and heightened political tensions following the Pahalgam attack and subsequent Indian air strikes. The National Paralympic Committee of Pakistan (NPCP) withdrew its sole athlete, Haider Ali, despite his qualification. World Para Athletics expressed disappointment, noting other athletes compete despite political conflicts.

title: Nasa-Isro's NISAR sends first radar images of Earth's surface
content: NASA and ISRO's joint NISAR satellite, launched in July 2025, has released its first radar images, showcasing Earth's surface in remarkable detail. The dual-band radar system provides unprecedented insight into forests, wetlands, farmland, and urban areas. These images highlight NISAR's potential for monitoring ecosystems, agriculture, and natural disasters.

title: 'Ba***ds of Bollywood' row: HC questions maintainability of Sameer Wankhede's plea
content: The Delhi High Court questioned the maintainability of Sameer Wankhede's defamation suit against Shahrukh Khan's Red Chillies Entertainment and Netflix, concerning the series 'The Ba***rds of Bollywood'. Wankhede alleges the series harms his reputation and seeks damages. The court granted Wankhede time to amend his application, arguing the series is streamed in Delhi, causing defamation there.

title: Exchange offers: Flipkart launches program for mobiles, electronics; Includes large appliances
content: Flipkart has broadened its exchange program across 26 product categories, including electronics and appliances, to enhance affordability and accessibility, especially in Tier 2 and 3 cities. The program features an AI-driven screening process for quick and reliable device evaluations. Customers can exchange old items for instant value on new purchases, promoting upgrades and responsible e-waste recycling.

title: A sentinel of skies: After 62 years in service, IAF bids farewell to MiG-21
content: After 62 years of service, the Indian Air Force bid farewell to the MiG-21, a Soviet-origin supersonic jet that played a crucial role in several conflicts, including the 1965 and 1971 wars, the Kargil war, and the Balakot strikes. Air Chief Marshal A P Singh flew the last sortie of the MiG-21 Bison aircraft. The final operations were carried out by the number 23 Squadron, nicknamed "Panthers."

title: On 80-yr-old's plea, SC orders eviction of his 61-yr-old son
content: The Supreme Court intervened in a poignant case, ordering a 61-year-old man to vacate his elderly parents' Mumbai properties. The octogenarian couple sought relief under the Maintenance and Welfare of Senior Citizens Act after their son failed to provide mandated support.

title: 40 minor girls found locked in toilet of illegal madrassa in UP
content: In Bahraich, authorities raided an illegal madrassa following local complaints, discovering forty minor girls confined in a bathroom. The operator, Khalil Ahmad, fled, while his daughter claimed it was a coaching center. Locals are suspicious of Ahmad's wealth and are demanding a thorough investigation, potentially involving the Enforcement Directorate, due to concerns about illegal activities.

title: ‚ÄòKnows better than anybody‚Äô: Trump‚Äôs veiled jibe at Erdogan over ‚Äòrigged elections‚Äô - watch
content: In a recent White House meeting, Donald Trump and Recep Tayyip Erdogan discussed reviving US-Turkey ties amidst geopolitical tensions. Trump playfully alluded to Erdogan's familiarity with 'rigged elections.' Key agenda points included Turkey's F-35 fighter jet program reinstatement and collaborative efforts to resolve the Gaza conflict.

title: Manmohan Singh‚Äôs 93rd birth anniversary: PM Modi pays tribute; recalls his contributions
content: Narendra Modi honored Manmohan Singh on his 93rd birth anniversary. Modi acknowledged Singh's service to the nation. Singh served as Prime Minister from 2004 to 2014. He is known for economic reforms as finance minister. Singh represented Assam in Rajya Sabha for three decades. Leaders remembered his role in shaping India's economy. He passed away on December 26, 2024.

title: Gold price prediction: What's the outlook for September 26?
content: Gold price prediction today: Jateen Trivedi of LKP Securities suggests a sell-on-rise strategy for gold, citing technical indicators signaling weakness. Gold futures face selling pressure amid cautious global markets and US economic data anticipation.

title: In dire need of runs: Surya's poor form a big concern for India in Asia Cup
content: Team India captain Suryakumar Yadav is in the middle of an unusual patch of form. In the last nine innings, he has mustered only 87 runs with an abysmal average of 12.42 and a strike rate of 112.98. In this Asia Cup, Surya has managed only 59 runs in four innings.

title: 100% on pharma products, 50% on kitchen cabinets: Trump rolls out new round of tariffs
content: Donald Trump announced significant tariffs on various goods, effective October 1st, 2025. A 100% tariff will be imposed on branded pharmaceuticals unless companies begin manufacturing in the US. Additionally, tariffs of 50% on kitchen cabinets and bathroom vanities, 30% on upholstered furniture, and 25% on heavy trucks aim to protect domestic industries.

title: CBSE reminder on Class 10, 12 LOC: Submission by Sept 30; late fee window Oct 3‚Äì11
content: CBSE has issued Reminder 3 for Class 10 and 12 LOC submission for 2025-26 exams. Schools must submit the List of Candidates by September 30, 2025, to avoid late fees. Fees through challan deadline has passed, so other payment modes should be used. The LOC portal closes at 11:59:59 p.m., reopening on October 3 for late submissions.

title: Milind Soman at 60: His breakfast routine and secret to his youthful look revealed,
content: Milind Soman, nearing 60, maintains his youthful energy through a simple diet rich in seasonal fruits. He emphasizes starting the day with fruits like papaya, mangoes, and bananas, avoiding processed foods. This approach, combined with wholesome lunches and dinners of dal, rice, and vegetables, contributes to his overall well-being and defies conventional aging expectations.

title: 'Ba***ds of Bollywood' row: Aryan Khan, Sameer Wankhede case explained in 5 points
content: Sameer Wankhede, the former NCB zonal director, has filed a lawsuit against Red Chillies Entertainment and Netflix, alleging defamation in Aryan Khan's 'Ba***ds of Bollywood.' Wankhede claims the series contains an obscene gesture towards ‚ÄúSatyamev Jayate‚Äù and negatively portrays anti-drug enforcement agencies.

title: Dr Neil K Anand, who treated 9/11 patients, sentenced to 14 years in prison
content: Dr Anand and his family disputed the allegations and said his compassion for his patients was fairly criminalized. They said Dr Anand went to ground zero on the day of 9/11 attack when he was an intern and treated patients. "The government is using artificial intelligence and manipulated data to prosecute me for treating chronic pain patients, turning tools meant to help into weapons against doctors," Dr Anand said earlier.

title: Ganga facing worst drying in 1,300 years, says IIT study
content: A recent study reveals the Ganga River faces its worst drying phase in 1,300 years, threatening water security for millions. Researchers attribute the decline to weakening monsoons, driven by human factors like pollution and groundwater depletion. The study emphasizes the urgent need for improved water management and climate-informed policies to safeguard the river's future.

title: Ex-French President Sarkozy convicted for 5 years in Libya campaign case
content: A Paris court found Nicolas Sarkozy guilty of criminal conspiracy. He was acquitted of corruption charges related to alleged illegal funding from Libya. The trial involved claims of Moamer Kadhafi's support for Sarkozy's 2007 campaign. Two aides were convicted, while another was acquitted. The ruling occurred after the death of a key accuser.

title: Trump‚Äôs 100% tariffs on pharma: Sun Pharma, Biocon, Cipla tank; jitters on D-Street
content: Pharmaceutical stocks, particularly Indian firms, plummeted following President Trump's announcement of 100% tariffs on imported branded medicines to the US. Companies like Sun Pharma, Biocon, and Zydus Lifesciences experienced significant declines.

title: 'Mark my words': Akhtar tells Pakistan how to beat India in Asia Cup final
content: Shoaib Akhtar believes Pakistan can defeat India in the Asia Cup 2025 final by dismissing Abhishek Sharma early and maintaining an aggressive mindset. Akhtar emphasized the importance of targeting Sharma in the initial overs, suggesting that his early dismissal could destabilize the Indian batting lineup. He also anticipates Gautam Gambhir will motivate India to bring their best game against Pakistan.

title: Obsessed with weed: Anti-ICE shooter hated US govt, targeted federal agents
content: A gunman, identified as Joshua Jahn, attacked a Dallas ICE facility, killing one migrant and wounding two others before fatally shooting himself. Jahn, described as a marijuana user with anti-government sentiments, meticulously planned the assault, targeting ICE personnel. Despite his family's claims of political disengagement, Jahn left anti-ICE messages at the scene.

title: Stock market today: Nifty50 opens in red; BSE Sensex down almost 200 points
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the Indian equity benchmark indices, opened in red on Friday on the back of weak global cues. While Nifty50 was just above 24,800, BSE Sensex was down almost 200 points.

title: 'Young people really wanted this': Trump approves TikTok deal with China; US takeover set
content: Donald Trump signed an executive order finalizing a deal allowing TikTok to operate in the US, with a majority stake moving to US investors like Oracle and Silver Lake. ByteDance will retain less than 20% equity. Much is still unknown about the actual arrangement, but Trump said Chinese President Xi Jinping ‚Äúgave us the go-ahead‚Äù to proceed with the deal.

title: India have a disappointing record against Pakistan in tournament finals
content: Pakistan clinched a spot in the Asia Cup final against India after a narrow 11-run victory over Bangladesh in Dubai. Pakistan's bowlers, Shaheen Shah Afridi and Haris Rauf, restricted Bangladesh to 124-9, securing the win. This sets up a highly anticipated final clash between the arch-rivals, marking their first-ever Asia Cup final encounter.

title: Asia Cup: ‚ÄòPut them under pressure' - Pak coach fires stern warning to India before final clash
content: Pakistan's coach, Mike Hesson, has urged his team to concentrate on cricket ahead of their historic Asia Cup final against India, despite recent controversies and heightened tensions. India has dominated recent encounters, winning both matches in the tournament and holding a seven-match winning streak against Pakistan.

title: World‚Äôs oldest person Maria Branyas Morera, 117: DNA study reveals secrets to long life
content: Maria Branyas Morera, the world's oldest person at 117, intrigued scientists with her exceptional longevity. A recent study analyzing her cells revealed a youthful genome, rare genetic variants linked to strong immunity, and heart and brain protection. Her Mediterranean diet, active lifestyle, and good habits also played a role.

title: Top stocks to buy: Stock recommendations for September 26- check list
content: Stock market recommendations: Bajaj Broking Research suggests a positive outlook despite recent market dips, recommending Sagility for a 12-month investment targeting ‚Çπ54.60 and Hindustan Zinc with a shorter-term goal of ‚Çπ505.

title: India ties hit as it backs & hosts Hasina: Muhammad Yunus
content: Muhammad Yunus criticized India for supporting Sheikh Hasina, alleging it strained relations due to India's disapproval of student protests against her. He accused Hasina of crimes and requested her extradition, while also dismissing reports of rising Islamic fundamentalism in Bangladesh as false. Yunus further suggested India was hindering SAARC's progress, emphasizing the need for regional cooperation.

title: Zach Charbonnet‚Äôs 2025 net worth, salary & Seahawks rise in NFL
content: Zach Charbonnet has quickly become a key player for the Seattle Seahawks, transitioning smoothly from college to the NFL. His four-year rookie contract, valued at $6,876,078, provides a solid financial base. With impressive stats and a rising net worth estimated between $2 million and $5 million, Charbonnet's future success hinges on upcoming games and potential endorsements.

title: US-Pak ties: Trump meets Shehbaz Sharif, Asim Munir; praises leaders
content: Donald Trump met with Pakistan's Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif and army chief Asim Munir, praising them as "great leaders." This meeting, following a recent trade deal and a brief encounter at the UN, signals a shift in Trump's stance towards Pakistan. Trump also emphasized Pakistan's strategic importance in Afghanistan, particularly regarding the Bagram Air Base.

title: Palestinian prez addresses UN via video after US blocks visa; condemns Oct 7 attack
content: Addressing the UN General Assembly virtually after the US denied his visa, Palestinian President Mahmoud Abbas urged global recognition of Palestine. He asserted that Hamas should relinquish control in Gaza, emphasizing the group's actions on October 7 do not represent the Palestinian people.

title: Will Sam Darnold play tonight vs Cardinals? Injury update
content: Seattle Seahawks will face Arizona Cardinals. All eyes are on quarterback Sam Darnold. He is fit to play. Coach Mike Macdonald praised Darnold's recent performance. Darnold highlighted the team's preparation and execution. The match is scheduled to begin at 8:15 p.m. ET. Fans are eager to witness the game. The team is hoping for a victory.

title: Anna Kournikova shows baby bump at Miami event, expecting 4th child
content: Anna Kournikova, 44, made a rare appearance in Miami, revealing her pregnancy with her fourth child with Enrique Iglesias. Spotted with her son Nicholas, her baby bump was visible, confirming earlier reports. The couple, together since 2001, already have three children and are reportedly very happy to be expanding their family.

title: Andre Agassi & Steffi Graf net worth 2025: Legacy, family & fortune
content: Andre Agassi and Steffi Graf, tennis legends with a combined fortune of $290 million in 2025, continue to impact the sport. Agassi captained Team World to victory at the Laver Cup, while Graf dedicates her time to family and charitable endeavors. Their children, Jaden and Jaz, were seen supporting their father at the Laver Cup, highlighting their enduring family legacy.

title: ‚ÄòI‚Äôm not for sale‚Äô: Out on bail, Azam Khan says he‚Äôll remain with SP
content: After his release from jail, Samajwadi Party leader Azam Khan reaffirmed his loyalty to Akhilesh Yadav, dismissing rumors of joining the BSP. Despite speculations fueled by reports of his wife's meeting with Mayawati, Khan stated he would remain with SP. He had faced multiple charges, including forgery and land grabbing, leading to imprisonment and disqualification from the UP assembly.

title: Man dies after village headman in Uttar Pradesh opens fire at his child's naming ceremony
content: The village headman, Sukhdev, arrived at the venue and began firing as he was not invited to the function

title: Ladakh protests: what do protesters want?
content: Here is what we know so far about the Ladakh protests, how the clashes in Leh unfolded, the demands driving the unrest, who is leading the movement, and what may come next.

title: ‚ÄòJal Prahar 2025‚Äô concludes with Indian Navy‚Äôs successful two-phase joint amphibious exercise with Army
content: Indian Navy concludes ‚ÄòJal Prahar 2025‚Äô joint exercise with Indian Army to enhance amphibious operations along eastern seaboard

title: Supreme Court dismisses plea seeking ban on Salman Rushdie‚Äôs novel ‚ÄòThe Satanic Verses‚Äô
content: The top court refuses plea to ban Salman Rushdie‚Äôs ‚ÄúThe Satanic Verses‚Äù citing lack of relevant notification

title: 1,000 kidney transplants and counting at Chennai‚Äôs Stanley Hospital
content: It was 29 years ago that the first renal transplant (living donor) was performed at SMCH. To date, a total of 1,006 renal transplants have been performed ‚Äî 837 from live related donors and 169 from deceased donors

title: Delhi HC questions Sameer Wankhede over maintainability of defamation plea against Aryan Khan‚Äôs ‚ÄòBa***ds of Bollywood‚Äô series
content: Senior advocate Sandeep Sethi, representing Mr. Wankhede, said the web series is meant for across cities, including Delhi, and the officer has been defamed here

title: Bihar‚Äôs 75 lakh women receive ‚Çπ10,000 each as PM launches scheme ahead of polls
content: The ‚Çπ7,500-crore scheme, an initiative of Bihar's NDA government, is aimed at promoting women's empowerment through self-employment and livelihood opportunities

title: Curfew remains in force for third day in Leh town
content: Police and paramilitary personnel in riot gear were seen patrolling the deserted streets to maintain law and order

title: Botanical Survey of India gets a new director, the first mycologist to head the institute
content: Kanad Das succeeds A. A. Mao as the 13th director of the BSI which was set up in 1890 and has 11 regional centers with four units headquartered in Kolkata

title: West Bengal school jobs case: Calcutta High Court grants bail to former Minister Partha Chatterjee
content: The Bench of Justice Suvra Ghosh directed Partha Chatterjee to surrender his passport and not leave the jurisdiction of the trial court, as conditions of the jail

title: MiG-21 flies through Indian skies for last time, Rajnath Singh terms it ‚Äònational pride‚Äô
content: The last of the MiG-21 jets, belonging to number 23 Squadron, nicknamed "Panthers" are being given a farewell at the decommissioning ceremony at the Chandigarh Air Force station

title: Chhattisgarh High Court asks CBI to resume probe in five year old case of embezzlement
content: A PIL filed by Kundan Singh Thakur in 2018 alleging a large-scale misappropriation of funds at the State Resource Centre and Physical Referral Rehabilitation Centre, 2 government-run institutions set up for the welfare of PwDs

title: Siddalinga Swami to approach High Court of Karnataka seeking action against district authorities, sand panel
content: The seer has said that the district administration and the sand monitoring committee have failed to take action in illegal sand mining case

title: Kerala rains: IMD sounds orange alert for four districts
content: Orange alert for Thiruvananthapuram, Pathanamthitta, Kottayam and Idukki districts, while Kollam, Alappuzha, Ernakulam, Thrissur and Palakkad are on yellow alert on Friday

title: Accessibility and Durga Pujas: How accessible are pandals in Kolkata
content: From accessibility plans to multiple awards, Durga Pujas in Kolkata are taking various initiatives to bring inclusivity into the festivities¬†

title: Three IndiGo flights bound for Hyderabad diverted to Vijayawada due to poor visibility
content: Flight disruptions at Hyderabad airport due to heavy rain, IndiGo flights diverted to Vijayawada, travel advisory issued by airline

title: Visakhapatnam‚Äôs anti-encroachment drive | Caught between changing cityscape and shattered livelihoods
content: ‚ÄòOperation Lungs 2.0‚Äô initiative aimed at streamlining street vending system and restoring public spaces in Visakhapatnam has been tagged as a ‚Äúdrive snatching away livelihoods in the name of urban beautification‚Äù

title: Tribal groups oppose Assam-Meghalaya hydropower project
content: The two State governments are jointly pursuing the 55 MW project on the Kulsi River, a natural habitat of the endangered Gangetic river dolphin

title: The slowly dying American dream
content: For decades, Hyderabad‚Äôs Ameerpet buzzed with a singular dream: study hard, land in the United States and secure a top job. But on September 19, President Donald Trump‚Äôs H-1B visa rule shake-up upended that aspiration with steep new costs and restrictions, forcing families and students to rethink futures, investments and even travel plans. At a time when COVID, AI, and automation are already rewriting careers, the promise of America suddenly feels distant and uncertain

title: Cauvery Aarti: Entry fee, vehicle toll for Brindavan Gardens waived, free laddoos for visitors
content: Deputy Chief Minister D.K. Shivakumar will inaugurate the Cauvery Aarti, which comprises traditional rituals, by offering flowers to Cauvery river as per the rituals

title: World requires global workforce, can‚Äôt escape this reality, says Jaishankar
content: The External Affairs Minister called for the creation of a more acceptable, contemporary, efficient model of a global workforce, which can then be located in a distributed, global workplace

title: Yamuna water quality improves, as flood waters flush out pollutants
content: Despite the improvement in September, the water quality did not meet bathing standards at most of the points along the stretch, where water was tested

title: Odisha puts districts on high alert for heavy rain as low-pressure area forms over Bay of Bengal
content: Instructions regarding it were issued to the district collectors through a video conference by Special Relief Commissioner (SRC) Deoranjan Kumar Singh

title: India sends fresh aid to quake-hit Afghanistan, relief reaches Kabul via Chabahar
content: On September 1, 2025, the Indian mission in Kabul sent truck loads of relief materials to the disaster-hit region of Kunar

title: Of men and their flying machines: Pilots hail legacy as MiG-21 prepares for swansong
content: The last of the MiG-21 jets, belonging to Squadron No. 23 and nicknamed "Panthers", will be given a farewell at the ceremony to be held at the Chandigarh Air Force station

title: Counting of votes for Assam‚Äôs BTC election begins
content: The Pramod Boro-led United People‚Äôs Party Liberal hopes to retain power on its own or in alliance with existing or new political entities

title: Citizens, domicile, and migrants: Why we should worry about Provincial Citizenship
content: Provincial citizenship emerges from nativist politics rooted in an emotional belonging to a State,¬†which gains immediate leverage in regional electoral politics. It challenges the idea of singular Indian citizenship, sparking debates over definitions of ‚Äònative‚Äô, ‚Äòindigenous‚Äô, ‚ÄòAdivasi‚Äô, ‚Äòlocal‚Äô, or ‚Äòson of the soil‚Äô

title: The right to be cool in a sweltering Global South
content: Access to air conditioning is currently severely limited in developing countries, including in India. Enhancing this access is urgently required as a public health safeguard and a necessity for adaptation to climate change. Cooling is no longer a matter of comfort for the Global South, but a frontline adaptation need

title: Telangana CM to hand over Group-I appointment orders on September 27
content: Chief Secretary K. Ramakrishna Rao reviewed the arrangements in a tele-conference with senior officials

title: ED questions actor Jagapati Babu in Sahiti Infra fraud probe
content: The ED collected details of the remuneration and payment methods received by the actor for appearing in promotional campaigns of Sahiti Infra

title: HMR Phase 1 handover likely next year as L&T‚Äôs 15-year Metro journey nears end
content: Despite financial losses, L&TMRH is credited with running a tight and efficient operation, maintaining clean infrastructure, minimal breakdowns, and high service frequency

title: Counting on change: On Karnataka‚Äôs long overdue survey of gender minorities
content: The¬†Karnataka government‚Äôs survey of gender¬†minorities, which commenced on September 15 across all 31 districts, has given hope to a large community that has been pushed to the shadows for long. Community members tell The Hindu that it shows the way forward, despite some concerns

title: Rains LIVE: Rain lashes Odisha as low pressure area intensifies into ‚Äòwell-marked system‚Äô
content: The Southwest monsoon is not expected to withdraw from Maharashtra before October 5 due to the low-pressure system

title: IMD issues orange alert for eight districts in Kerala
content: The District Collector of Thiruvananthapuram declared a holiday for educational institutions, including professional colleges, in the district and IMD¬†cautioned fishers from putting their boats out to sea

title: Ladakh violence: J&K CM Abdullah defends Congress, accuses BJP of blaming others for its failures
content: Mr. Abdullah said the Lieutenant Governor-led Ladakh administration should see why it failed in the first place to take necessary measures to maintain peace

title: Rajasthan man arrested on charges of espionage for Pakistan in Jaisalmer
content: Rajasthan CID Intelligence arrests Hanif Khan, a suspected Pakistani spy, for allegedly sharing confidential Indian Army information with Pakistan‚Äôs intelligence agency

title: A place linked to soldiers for long
content: The Defence Services Staff College was relocated from¬†Quetta, Pakistan, to Wellington only after Independence.¬†But the¬†Nilgiris¬†had a long association with soldiers. The British opened a depot in the mountains for its regiments to convalesce in 1862

title: A rare 200-year-old Navaratri custom in which deities are taken from¬†Tamil Nadu to¬†Kerala¬†
content: A few days before the¬†Navaratri¬†celebrations, a spectacular event takes place in¬†Kanniyakumari¬†district, once part of the erstwhile¬†Travancore.¬†Its history dates back to more than 200 years. Even today, it reminds the local people of the strong cultural bonds between Tamil Nadu and Kerala beyond political boundaries

title: The megalithic dolmens of¬†Kodaikanal¬†dating back to 5,000 years
content: Only less than 50% of the dolmens (megalithic structures), recorded by Reverend A.¬†Anglade¬†S.J. and Reverend L.V. Newton¬†S.J., are standing in the hills.¬†At¬†Pethuparai, dolmens have been fenced by the Archaeological Survey of India. At¬†Thandikudi, they are vanishing, and some have disappeared under thick vegetation. More measures are needed to preserve them

title: Terrorism ‚Äòpersistent threat‚Äô to development, says EAM Jaishankar in G20 Foreign Ministers‚Äô meeting
content: External Affairs Minister Jaishankar emphasises the need to combat terrorism and reform multilateralism for global stability and development

title: Mohan Majhi government plans to strengthen cooperative movement in Odisha in a big way
content: Creation of unified marketing brand‚Äîunder the name of either Utkal or Kalinga‚Äîto promote Odisha‚Äôs products in international markets has been mooted

title: Six arrested in Amritsar with 4 k.g. heroin, 2 pistols: Punjab Police
content: Preliminary investigation revealed that the accused persons were in touch with a Pakistan-based handler named Shah through social media, the DGP said

title: Outrage over infant deaths in Indore | In India‚Äôs cleanest city, rats in a hospital
content: Two infants died this September after rats bit them in the NICU of a government hospital in Indore, sparking outrage. However, the Madhya Pradesh government claims that the cause of death was pre-existing medical conditions.¬†Mehul Malpani¬†reports on the gaps in hygiene and safety standards in decades-old facilities and the overburdened public healthcare system in the State

title: Maharashtra rains: CM seeks ‚Äòsubstantial‚Äô Central assistance
content: Death toll rises to 86; Fadnavis submits a two-page memorandum to Union Home Minister Amit Shah, stating that the govt. has approved ‚Çπ2,215 crore from the SDRF, but it could be ‚Äòinadequate‚Äô

title: On Devi Lal birth anniversary, INLD takes the fight to the Hoodas in Rohtak
content: Mr. Chautala promised to provide free electricity and double the old age pension on returning to power

title: Palestine issue not a Muslim-Jew conflict, but a humanitarian crisis: Ambassador
content: Abdullah M. Abu Shawesh addresses ‚ÄòGaza Solidarity Conference‚Äô organised by the Indian Union Muslim League. Recalling that India was among the first nations to recognise the State of Palestine, he says India‚Äôs solidarity with Palestine stems from a shared history

title: Aaditya Thackeray to brief the media on ‚Äòvoter fraud‚Äô in Maharashtra
content: He confirmed that the press conferences would be similar to those conducted by Rahul Gandhi, and he would be providing information on these poll irregularities

title: Helping Gen Z percussionists find their rhythm
content: ‚ÄòGen Z Beats‚Äô, an initiative to build a national network of young tabla artistes from Kerala, is set to begin this December under the leadership of percussionist Arjun Kaliprasad

title: Telangana to introduce breakfast scheme in schools, 69% reservation in local bodies: Revanth Reddy
content: Tamil Nadu is a leader in education, nutrition and sports, and all other States are inspired by its education model, says Telangana Chief Minister

title: Social and Educational survey: Over 1.82 lakh households in Karnataka covered in four days
content: The State-wide Social and Educational survey being undertaken by the Karnataka State Commission for Backward Classes entered its fourth day with mixed progress across districts¬†

title: SPV modalities being readied for shipbuilding cluster at Dugarajapatnam, says Minister
content: The State government has issued guidelines for promoting shipbuilding cluster and announced financial incentives, exemptions and subsidies, says Janardhan Reddy

title: Indrakeeladri in Vijayawada witnesses VIP rush, chaos during Kumkum Archana
content: Many women fail to take part in rituals, despite having tickets; devotees complain that they are made to wait for hours while VIPs are given a priority

title: Connect with workers, build teams, Congress tells leaders

title: A.P. Assembly passes amendment Bill on Building Penalisation Scheme

content: Originating from Secunderabad, the train will cover Dwaraka, Somnath, Ahmedabad, Patan and Statue of Unity

title: Bengaluru to get adaptive traffic signals at 110 junctions
content: The Karnataka Cabinet approved installation of adaptive traffic signals at 110 busy junctions in Bengaluru city, to ease traffic movement

title: Artificial Intelligence and Gaming Lab inaugurated at Government Sri Krishnarajendra Silver Jubilee Technological Institute

title: India, Russia discuss BRICS grain exchange plan to boost agriculture trade ties

content: In a letter he said that it is ‚Äúan exclusive private property owned by a listed company, not meant for public thoroughfare.‚Äù¬†

title: A bumpy ride on highways with misery for company
content: Under-construction stretches of NH 544 and NH 66, which have long overshot deadlines, are posing huge problems for motorists as well as those residing near the project sites. Mini Muringatheri interacts with both parties to highlight their plight and the continuing apathy of the authorities

title: Leh remains tense a day after death of four persons

title: News: Rangers shut down third player this week; Padres lose Laureano

title: Coaches outmaneuver NFL's defenses with court ruling on arbitration
content: two separate courts have ruled in favor of coaches' challenges to arbitration requirements . one panel labeled the league's arbitration process "unconscionable" and another called it "unworthy even of the name of arbitration" a spokesman did not provide comment, but legal analysts say the court decisions are likely to have a wider impact on the power dynamic between the league and its employees .

title: College football September transfer surprises
content: the best players available in college football's transfer portal are making millions . talent evaluation is still the name of the game during the portal season . this is not exactly an early all-transfer team; we'll get to that later in the season.

title: Early-season angst check: Do Madrid, Man United, Wrexham need to be worried?
content: the offseason is for either angst or excitement, and for the nine entities below -- eight clubs and one league -- there was more of the latter than latter . let's check in on whether the angster is growing or dissipating for the motley crew of Real Madrid , Manchester City , the Bundesliga , Wrexham , Newcas .

title: Top storylines to watch at the 2025 Ryder Cup
content: team USA captain Keegan Bradley and team Europe captain Luke Donald are both eager and ready for the 2025 Ryder Cup to begin Friday . the first match of the day will go off at 7:10 a.m. the parings for the first four matches will be announced Thursday afternoon .

title: Transfer rumors, news: Mainoo linked with Man United departure
content: Kobbie Mainoo wants to leave the club on loan despite holding talks with manager Ruben Amorim . the 20-year-old is expected to push for a temporary move away from old trafford . mainoo is reported to have been informed that he is in the club's first-team plaza .
